CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, Philadelphia edition, May 11, 1940, pg. 1 reads: "Naked agony in the inset as Bishop W. T. Vernon hears the Episcopal Committee of the A.M.E. Church turn down his plea for reinstatement at the Detroit convention.Picture below shows the Bishop as he makes his futile plea.-(Exclusive staff photo by Harris)Cutline of article published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper Philadelphia edition, May 11, 1940, pg. 1 reads: " 'In God's Name Have Mercy!' Shouts Vernon As Conference Blasts Hopes - Delegates Deaf to Eloquent Plea of Former Leader in Church - Episcopal Committee Firm for Retirement, but Refuses to Pass on Character. - FLASH! No Appeal for Vernon! - Detroit, Mich., May 9 - In a heated battle on the Conference...Monday morning. Bishop W.T. Vernon lost his last chance to appeal the decision of the body made Saturday when his reinstatement...active bishop was refused.  The vote to reconsider was...against."  Portion of accompanying article by Julia B. Jones reads: "Detroit, May 9 - A torrent of "ayes" and "Nays" burst forth here Saturday morning when the all-powerful Episcopal Committee, in its first report to the Assembly, recommended that Bishop W.T. Vernon of Kansas remain...the retired list..."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of men and women, including Bishop W. T. Vernon speaking into microphone in Ebenezer AME Church for AME General Conference, Detroit
